特記事項: 本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。 The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Classes will be conducted by in-person format in the classroom unless designated otherwise due to unexpected circumstances.
Students should read the assigned reading materials before coming to class. This class will be interactive. The students will be asked to read the assigned material out loud, answer questions, participate in discussions and give presentations. There will also be some take-home assignments.

第2回:
What is "Bilingualism"?
Who is a bilingual? Types of bilinguals
第3回:
Bilingual Education in Canada: French Immersion Programs
Bilingual Families in Montreal, Quebec
第4回:
Language choice in multilingual communities
The "Domain" concept, Diglossia and Polyglossia: cases of Switzerland, Paraguay, Congo, Singapore, etc.
第5回:
Code-switching: reasons, types and conversational strategy
Cases of English and French, English and Japanese
第6回:
Language maintenance and shift
How can a minority language be maintained?
第8回: Pidgins and Creoles: focus on "Tok Pisin" of Papua New Guinea
第10回:
Definition of "official languages" and "national languages"
Official and national languages of the world: Paraguay, India, New Zealand, Congo, Haiti, etc.
第11回:
Theory of Language Planning and Language Policy
Types of implementation of language planning: cases of Belgium, Switzerand and Finland
